p: A 51-year-old Caucasian male presented to the emergency department during a COVID-19 outbreak with a suspected ST-elevation myocardial infarction. The patient complained of sudden but persistent chest pain, which had developed 1 day before hospital admission. The pain was sharp, worsened with deep breathing or a change in body position, and was alleviated while sitting. The pain lasted for several hours during the night, but then gradually and spontaneously disappeared. He did not have any respiratory symptoms and denied respiratory or any other infection or acute illness in the previous 3 months.
